intro: Bunium brachyactis, commonly known as the narrow-leaved fennel, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs such as parsley and dill. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and finely divided, feathery leaves. Its small yellow flowers are typically arranged in umbels, a common feature among members of its family. Bunium brachyactis is often found in rocky or dry habitats and is valued for its aromatic properties.
